p: In addition, the anti-hyperthyroid effect of several members of the Lamiaceae family plants such as Rosmarinus officinalis L., Melissa officinalis L., Lycopus europaeus L. , Ocimum basilicum L., Origanum vulgare L., Origanum majorana L., Salvia verbenaca L. and even in some members of Boraginaceae family like Lithodora fruticose (L.) Griseb. is attributed to rosmarinic acid. This molecule is supposed to inhibits TSH effects on receptor sites, constrains immunoglobulin effects on TSH receptors, and reduces peripheral conversion of thyroxine to T3 ( Bharthi et al., 2017, Eric and Kathy, 2006, Miraj et al., 2017).
